participants: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message: Does anyone know what an exported annotator file looks like? I've been trying to export and it has been showing the "Working...." message for ~5 min.

I am not sure  if annotator still works. it seems that nobody uses this app? maybe that’s already on the deprecated list the OS team maintains?

On a separate note, I really think we should take down apps that are not actively maintained / do not have clear ownership ASAP. Many apps simply just no longer work, “deprecating” something that doesn’t work isn’t very meaningful….
going to cc a few people that might know how annotator works / was designed for @Erick @Aaron Vontell
cc:@Jessica
Hmm I’m not sure what exporting was for. I’m pretty sure it generates ibml files like redactor or old visual refiner.
But that’s just for saving. Agreed @Kerry that we should get rid of them in the UI

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message: @Kerry I don't think annotator was deprecated: https://instabase.com/docs/reference/apps/deprecated/

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message: Yes, we decided to keep it as a beta app: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1R2UI9q8cgb40MbWFMHjuRmYOkZ5mcUgHJCAsbyEN7Q8/edit

:thinking_face: ok seems that this app is owned by doc insights. let me go back to the team and figure out how we want to do with it, and establish ownership @georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
Yep annotator was not deprecated. I UAT annotator so I guess I am the point person :sweat_smile: I usually test the exporting of the annotations, but not of text, so that may be broken
@Erick about that list: should probably deprecate redactor too? since now it’s a flow step and not an app anymore.
Yep and visual refiner please :blush:
And table refiner probably haha
Redactor, visual refiner, and table refiner are all being deprecated
If you go to the apps, you'll see that they have a deprecated tag on them

messages.sender: georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire
messages.message: @Kerry with Redactor as a flow step, will you still be able to open the redactor app to build your redaction targets? Or how will that be done now?
@Hari for Annotator, could we use some of what we're building for GS?

@georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire redaction now becomes a flow step after apply refiner, and will redact the fields extracted by refiner. @Erick might have a doc here - can you share this Erick if you have a doc, if not, we can create one and follow up with Georgia next week.

@nakul about annotator - i actually really want to revamp it to make it a tool for creating golden data for evaluating extraction accuracy and / or for training ML models. what are we building for GS here?
apply redactor flow step doc: https://instabase.com/docs/reference/apps/flow/step-config-reference/apply-redactor-refined-fields/
@nakul @georgia chestnuts rust-ing on an open fire Yes! The NER Training UI is meant to do this and some more! Can you let me know what they are trying to do with the annotator?
